Demonstrates examples of passing arrays as parameters

Method Detail

copy

public void copy(int[] source,
                 int[] target)
Copy source to target

printList

public void printList(int[] list)
list is a reference parameter. list is the same array as the array named data in the driver class

rotateList

public void rotateList(int[] list)
This function is working with a local copy of the array passed as an argument. Changes to local array list will have no effect on the array data in the calling method. This function will shift each value one cell to the right. The value in list[list.length-1] will be moved to list[0]. Before the function is completed, printList will be called. The point of this function is to illustrate an array as a value parameter.

squareList

public void squareList(int[] list)
Array list is a local alias for the array data in the driver class. Any reference to a local list is a reference to array data in the driver class.
